title: Vanity Fair - as a member of Parliament, Sir Pitt

content.question: The passage suggests that, as a member of Parliament, Sir Pitt was

choices.label: competent and respected by his colleagues
a servant of the cause of the British aristocracy
using his position for selfish ends

content.answer: using his position for selfish ends

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
